projects: [{'title': 'Petrophysical characterization and seismic modeling of Lacustrine carbonates from the Madrid Basin', 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': '(With Prof. Dr. John Reijmer): Forward seismic modelling and Petrophysical characterization of Lacustrine carbonates from the Madrid Basin. The goal of this research is to understand how the depositional environment of lacustrine carbonates affects the petrophysical and acoustic properties of the lithologyâ€™s. Another objective is using forward seismic modelling to investigate whether these artefacts can be recognized on seismic datasets. We are working on publishing a scientific paper on the results of this study. This project gave me the ability to work with several laboratory instruments and to use numerical modelling in order to simulate geological and geophysical processes. (Reijmer@kfupm.edu.sa or https://johnreijmer.com )', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Yanto', 'last_name': 'Hogendorp', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Petroleum Engineer | Petrophysicist | Shell | CCS | New business development | Views are my own'}]}, {'title': 'Imperial Barrel Award 2017', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, 'description': 'The Imperial Barrel award is a prestigious competition in which universities send their top five students who will analyse a dataset in a boiler room situation consisting of seismics and well logs. The teams will be judged based on a presentation ranking the prospectivity of a basin for hydrocarbon exploration. We became third of all European teams, the highest ranking of all Dutch teams in 2017 and the highest ranking of the VU university Amsterdam in its entire history! This competition was a great experience in working as a team on an exploration and production case.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Yanto', 'last_name': 'Hogendorp', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Petroleum Engineer | Petrophysicist | Shell | CCS | New business development | Views are my own'}]}]
